body: There might be a more efficient way of doing this, but I haven't noticed any interface lag issues with my limited testing. Edit: I ended up doing it the more efficient way because there's really no excuse not to. Two things to note: 1. This reverts this commit https://github.com/TokTok/toxic/commit/d6fdac973902457c7a94ec3113253838cfa12c53 which I don't really know why I approved of in the first place 2. It doesn't attempt to handle multi-byte characters. That's a pretty big undertaking which I'll leave for another day. --- This change isâ€‚[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/toxic/149)

comment_data.body: Should tab be treated as a newline? Not a space character?
Tabs were actually parsed correctly to begin with, not sure why I did that.

commit.message:
Remove seconds from default timestamp

Also reduce the --- prefix to one dash before a message. These characters are taking
up valuable real-estate
